cyclone.name: HENRI
cyclone.current_location: about 280 mi (450 km) SW of Bermuda
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn sharply north on Friday and track north-northwest toward southern New England late this weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southern New England (near Long Island / Rhode Island coast)

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Atlantic coast from Cape Hatteras NC northward through New England and Atlantic Canada
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with occasional tropical-storm-force gusts (25–40 mph) possible Saturday night through early Sunday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible in Delaware Bay; significant surge above 3 ft not expected
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible in bands late Saturday into Sunday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and high surf along the Delaware and New Jersey coasts could hamper pilot transfers and small-craft operations
